overview:
Donald Hall joined Arcturus Capital in 2001 following over fifteen years of institutional investment experience at Zurich Scudder Investments, the successor to Scudder, Stevens & Clark. In his role as a senior portfolio manager at the $250 billion firm, he evaluated hundreds of companies and management teams and interacted regularly with the corresponding industry analysts and investment bankers.

Mr. Hall conceived an equity selection strategy that attracted over $2.5 Billion in assets that he and his team managed, including an equity mutual fund launched in 1993 that ultimately earned a five star rating by Morningstar. Mr. Hall contributed heavily to the firm’s equity valuation and asset allocation processes, and served as Chair of the firm’s Asset Allocation Committee.

His past private equity pursuits included a comprehensive research effort for Zurich Scudder assessing the opportunities in venture capital, serving as an early stage venture fund advisor and financing several early stage ventures for his own account.

Mr. Hall is a member of several professional and community organizations and boards. He became a Chartered Financial Analyst after receiving his Bachelor of Science in Engineering from Auburn University and Masters in Business Administration from Harvard University.
